tags: ['season premiere', 'series premiere', 'pasadena california', 'year 1963', 'new home', 'year 2019', 'reference to nasa', 'supermarket', 'gossip', 'photo booth strip of photos', 'payphone', 'woman slaps a man', 'attempted suicide', 'ambulance', 'waitress', 'diner', 'reference to california state fullerton', 'woman wears a bikini', 'cheating husband', 'bend down exposing cleavage', 'woman wears a black bikini', 'woman kisses teenage boy', '17 year old boy', 'gay husband', 'bisexual woman', 'love triangle', 'houseguest', 'open marriage', 'multiple storylines', '1980s', '2010s', "wife meets husband's girlfriend", 'wealthy couple', 'teenage boy attracted to older woman', 'woman undresses', 'woman undresses in front of a man', 'sexual tension', 'sexual attraction', 'neighbor neighbor relationship', 'housewife', 'rocket scientist', 'female lawyer', 'screenwriter', 'swimming pool', 'volvo', 'california', 'pasadena', 'los angeles california', 'mansion']
synopsis_with_character_names:
In the opening monologue, the husbands Rob, Karl and Eli, talk about how they met their wives and how happy they were until their wives discovered their secrets.

In 1963, Rob and Beth Ann Stanton move into their mansion in Pasadena following the death of their daughter. After meeting Leo and Sheila Mosconi, Beth Ann overhears Sheila reveal that Leo witnessed Rob kissing a waitress at a diner in Glendale. Beth Ann refuses to believe her husband's infidelity until he calls Beth Ann and tells her he's meeting a client. Beth Ann goes to the diner, and sees Rob kiss the waitress. At Sheila's advice, Beth Ann goes to the diner to confront the waitress, whom she learns is named April. However, Beth Ann loses her nerve and instead befriends April, although she keeps her identity secret from her husband's mistress by saying her name is Sheila.

In 1984, Simone and Karl are hosting a house party. Simone receives an mysterious envelope addressed to her, with a strip of photo booth pictures of Karl kissing a man inside. Simone confronts Karl and wordlessly confesses that there have been others. She demands that he packs. Later, Simone finds Karl slumped on a chair in the bedroom having attempted suicide by overdosing on pills. Simone swiftly calls an ambulance, with the neighbors congregating outside. Simone lies and tells them he fell down the stairs. Her friend, Wanda, who has long resented Simone for always flaunting about money and how perfect her life is while she works through a divorce and drinking problem, doesn't buy her lie. She reveals she was the one who sent the pictures of Karl kissing a man in the envelope. Simone pins her to the ground, with an EMT having to pull them apart. The next day, Naomi's son, Tommy, who was a waiter at the party, admits to Simone that he saw the photos and makes a romantic pass at her. Simone declines his advances, but Tommy states that unlike the men she married, he is in love with her.

In 2019, Taylor and her husband Eli have an open marriage. Taylor breaks the "no hookups in the house" rule when she lets her lover, Jade, stay for the weekend after she is threatened by a dangerous ex-boyfriend, Duke. Eli initially opposes, but eventually agrees when he finds himself becoming attracted to her, and allows her to stay longer if she wanted.

In the closing monologue, the wives Beth Ann, Simone and Taylor talk about a woman's motive for killing, who they would kill and could they get away with it.

description: The isolated and rich Montana Max one day opens his mansions' window, shouting out the word 'Acme.' Hampton goes on a quest to then find out what this strange utterance could mean. His journey takes him on a quest through Max's poor past, and into his huge (but scandalous) run for Class President.
tags: ['marc anthony the bulldog character', 'pete puma character', '2d animation', 'cat']
synopsis_with_character_names:
As the show opens, we see Montana Max in his mansion, angrily tearing up his room, and throwing his toys around. Suddenly, he chances upon a mirror, and seeing himself, mutters one word: "Acme."

This is followed by him throwing open his nearby window, and bellowing "Acme!" out into the night sky.

A newsreel is then shown, that chronicles Max's life. How from poor beginnings, Max's parents won the lottery, and his life changed, but he did as well. After having his parents arrested for making him eat broccoli, Max took charge of the family empire, and made a major move in running for Acme Looniversity Class President, which ended in a scandal that caused Max to be expelled.

The newsreel (for the Looniversity's newspaper), perplexes its reporters that it needs a hook. Hampton J Pig, Shirley the Loon, and Bookworm are perplexed by Max's 'last word,' of "Acme."

Hampton is put on the case, and goes on to interview people who knew Monty during his campaign.

First he visits Buster Bunny, who knew Max from long ago. Max was once a poor kid, who was kind and genial to Buster. However, once Max's family won the lottery, things changed.

From there, Hampton visits Plucky Duck, who Max hired as his campaign manager for the Looniversity's Class President election. Plucky was witness as Max purchased the Looniversity's TV studio, and made its ads lean more towards his view on things, slandering Buster in the process. Plucky also relates during an interview with Buster, how Max claimed to have found stolen test answers that Buster used, and Buster was then expelled.

From there, Hampton goes to Elmyra, who was Max's girlfriend at the time, but she provides few answers, and no clue as to what "Acme" means.

After this, Buster and Babs meet with Hampton, and explain how after Buster was expelled, Plucky confided in them about Max's planting of the test answers, framing Buster. With Max's victory looking assured, the three then tricked him into admitting he framed Buster, which resulted in his eventual loss for Student Body President, and expulsion from the Looniversity.

After this, the three walk down a street near Max's residence, still not sure what Max meant. Buster ponders that Max was a kid who could have had anything. Maybe "Acme" was something he couldn't obtain.

Suddenly, Max's voice calls down to them from his room. It is then he admits that he didn't say "Acme," he said "Acne." He had cried out because he was distraught at having a bad case of "Acne."

Hampton then faints, as what he thought was an important thing, turned out to be nothing.

description: Following the accidental release of long-imprisoned evil space-sorceress Rita Repulsa, a benevolent sage known as Zordon drafts a group of five teenagers to help protect the planet as Dino-powered warriors of goodness.
tags: ['tripping and falling', 'gymnasium', 'lever', 'gem', 'exercise equipment', 'futuristic tank', 'megazord', 'robotic animal', 'machine', 'teenager', 'b sci fi', 'kids family', 'martial arts action', 'superhero action', 'superhero fantasy', 'superhero sci fi', 'team action', 'teen adventure', 'juice bar', 'prison', 'slow motion scene', 'genius', 'teenage genius', 'magical staff', 'monster versus robot', 'gum chewing', 'robot cockpit', 'karate gi', 'minion', 'space dumpster', 'putty creature', 'megazord power sword', 'robot monster battle', 'megazord tank', 'human versus creature', 'explosion', 'crosshair', 'view through telescope', 'clay model', 'sabertooth tiger dinozord', 'triceratops dinozord', 'pterodactyl dinozord', 'mastodon dinozord', 'tyrannosaurus dinozord', 'putty patroller', 'clay creature', 'teddy bear', 'cityscape', 'earthquake', 'telescope']
synopsis_with_character_names:
When a strange planetoid appears near the moon, two astronauts are sent to investigate. They discover an ancient space dumpster, and mistakenly open it, freeing the Evil Space Aliens trapped within for the past 10,000 years.

Intergalactic sorceress Rita Repulsa and her goons (Goldar, a golden armored Ape/Griffin; Baboo, a blue-furred flying monkey; Squatt, Baboo's stout blueberry-colored pal; and Finster, a white dog-like inventive creature) set their sights on the nearby planet, Earth. Luckily, the mystical sage behind Rita's original imprisonment, Zordon of Eltar, has remained there (trapped in a Time Warp, limiting him to appearing as just a transmission of his head inside of a large plasma tube), awaiting her eventual escape.

At his Command Center building, he has his robotic assistant, Alpha 5, seek out a group of five brave teenagers with attitudes to combat the aliens. Alpha plucks five friends from a Juice Bar in the town of Angel Grove, California.

They're reluctantly given Power Morphers, which enable them to transform their bodies into magical suits empowered by the spirits of dinosaurs. After facing Rita's foot-soldiers, the Putty Patrollers, the five teens are convinced of the danger, and agree to become the Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: Jason, the Red Tyrannosaurus Ranger; Zack, the Black Mastodon Ranger; Billy, the Blue Triceratops Ranger; Trini, the Yellow Sabertooth Tiger Ranger; and Kimberly, the Pink Pterodactyl Ranger.

Together, they can call forth massive fighting machines based on their respective dinos, and combine those into a single huge humanoid robot Megazord. They use the Megazord to run off Goldar, who attacks Angel Grove and with Rita's magic, soon grows gigantically. After the successful battle, the five teens agree to help Zordon & Alpha 5 defend the Earth for as long as it takes.

description: Trini must overcome her fear of heights to save Billy.
tags: ['supervillainess', 'exercise equipment', 'lighting a fuse', 'match', 'lever', 'robotic animal', 'machine', 'b sci fi', 'kids family', 'martial arts action', 'superhero action', 'superhero fantasy', 'superhero sci fi', 'team action', 'teen adventure', 'female warrior', 'amusement park', 'scale model', 'blade blaster pistol', 'putty creature', 'skull mask', 'globe', 'tail attack', 'robot monster battle', 'giant', 'tyrannosaurus dinozord', 'quarry', 'pistol', 'skeleton warrior', 'futuristic pistol', 'fissure', 'bomb fuse', 'bomb', 'alternate dimension', 'time warp', 'blade blaster', 'clay creature', 'overcoming fear', 'cactus', 'human versus creature', 'putty patroller', 'remote control', 'view through telescope', 'cityscape', 'crosshair', 'telescope', 'time device', 'skeleton monster', 'clay sculpture', 'space shuttle model']
synopsis_with_character_names: After an incident involving rope climbing at the youth center, it is discovered that Trini has a fear of heights. Billy makes communicators and accidently ties into the teleportation system of the Command Center. Rita opens a time trap, intending to capture the The Power Rangers the same way she once trapped Zargon. While Zargon analyzes the time trap, the Rangers must fight a group of putties who gathered outside of town. During the fight, Billy finds himself trapped on a cliff top, and Trini must overcome her fear in order to save her friend. The Rangers manage to defeat the putties without morphing. The Rangers then transform and are then sent to the amusement park, where they have to engage Ritas latest monster, Bones in battle, but he traps them and himself in the time trap. The Power Rangers must then fight Bones and some of Ritas hengemen to be able to get out of the trap. After they succeed, another enemy awaits them, but Jason (Red) uses the Tyrannosaurus dinozord and prevails. When the fighting is done, the gang relaxes at the youth center when they overhear someone gossiping about the new super heroes in town. They smile and walk over to the workout section, when Zack sneaks up on Trini while wearing a scary mask. She then unintentionally proves that she has overcome her fear of heights by climbing the rope to the ceiling.

description: Kimberly is in trouble when her uncle Steve succumbs to a sleeping potion in the middle of flying an airplane with her on board.
tags: ['aircraft pilot', 'moai', 'payphone', 'unconsciousness', 'emergency response vehicle', 'propeller aeroplane', 'crush', 'small aircraft', 'distraction', 'spiking a drink', 'airplane in trouble', 'sleeping on a plane', 'flying a plane', 'b sci fi', 'kids family', 'martial arts action', 'superhero action', 'superhero fantasy', 'superhero sci fi', 'team action', 'teen adventure', 'flying an airplane', 'sleeping potion', 'airplane', 'male pilot', 'uncle niece relationship', 'flashback', 'female supervillain', 'snake lizard monster', 'hybrid monster', 'punk teenager', 'power dagger', 'blade blaster pistol', 'putty creature', 'snizzard', 'doctor', 'fire truck', 'aircraft landing', 'fountain', 'smelling salts', 'backpack', 'ambulance', 'helicopter', 'landing an airplane', 'park fountain', 'snake', 'tail attack', 'futuristic pistol', 'blade blaster', 'calling for help']
synopsis_with_character_names: Kimberly is going flying with her Uncle Steve. Bulk and Skull decide to tag along. Rita learns of Kim's plans and makes her own nefarious scheme. Kim recalls her first time in the mountains she's flying over, when she first became a Power Ranger. Uncle Steve becomes dizzy and then unconscious, and the plane begins to drop. Kim tries to fly the plane and contacts Zordon and Alpha for help. Rita sends a monster to Angel Grove, causing the alarms to go off in the Command Center. Zordon contacts the rest of the Rangers and Alpha gives Kim an impromptu flight lesson. The rest of the Rangers go off to fight Rita'a newest monster while Kim's plane is running out of fuel. The Rangers struggle in their fight without Kim. Alpha coaches Kimberly through landing the plane. With the plane safely landed, Kim runs off to help the other Power Rangers. It's Morphin' Time! With Kim now in the battle the tides turn and Kim is able to rescue her friends and then defeat the skizzard.

synopsis_with_character_names: After an incident with Bulk and Skull, Billy decides to re-enroll in Jason's Karate class. A famous scientist and martial artist is coming to Angel Grove, and he's Trini's uncle! Rita is after Uncle Howard's invisibility formula and sends putties, who capture Trini's uncle while out with Billy. The putties bring Uncle Howard to the Dark Warrior, Rita's latest monster. The Rangers now have to find the formula to recover Uncle Howard from Rita's clutches. The Rangers go to save Trini's uncle and are confronted by more putties. The putties are defeated, but the Rangers must still disconnect Uncle Howard from the bomb, which billy does with his karate enhanced concentration. The Rangers confront the Dark Warrior. It's Morphin' Time! Rita makes the Dark Warrior grow, and the Rangers counter with DinoZord power. The DinoZords assemble into the MegaZord, and then into MegaZord Battle Mode. When the MegaZord receives the Power Sword they are able to defeat the Dark Warrior. Billy receives the Yellow belt in Jason's Karate class. Uncle Howard finds his invisibility formula, and then uses it to help Billy against Bulk and Skull.

description: Billy's latest invention goes haywire, causing him to switch bodies with Kimberly.
tags: ['computer screen', 'supervillainess', 'futuristic tank', 'gymnasium', 'dog', 'high school', 'schoolteacher', 'megazord', 'lever', 'locker', 'scream', 'shout', 'robotic animal', 'body swap', 'experiment gone wrong', 'teleporter', 'screaming no', 'makeup', 'computer lessons', 'explosion', 'exploding computer', 'sandwich', 'magic lamp', 'b sci fi', 'kids family', 'martial arts action', 'superhero action', 'superhero fantasy', 'superhero sci fi', 'team action', 'teen adventure', 'female warrior', 'dog barks', 'putty creature', 'gum chewing', 'hand drill', 'oil lamp', 'robot monster battle', 'megazord tank', 'power crystal', 'pterodactyl dinozord', 'sabertooth tiger dinozord', 'triceratops dinozord', 'mastodon dinozord', 'tyrannosaurus dinozord', 'magical staff', 'clay creature', 'putty patroller', 'park', 'genie monster']
synopsis_with_character_names: Billy's newest machine has been vandalized by one of Rita's crew. Rita decides to send down the Genie. Billy has made a mind-reading machine. Bulk and Skull overhear Billy telling Kimberly this. Billy and Kimberly try to test out his machine. Bulk and Skull notice their being watched by a dog and are chased off. Meanwhile, something goes wrong with the test, and Billy and Kimberly have switched bodies. Rita's crew rubs the lamp and summon the Genie. Goldar orders the Genie to attack the Power Rangers. Bulk and Skull sneak into Billy's lab to try out his machine as well, with the same disastrous result. Billy and Kimberly struggle trying to live each others lives. The Genie is taken down to earth in the lamp and released. Zordon sends the Rangers to try and recover the lamp. The putty patrol decides to attack. It's Morphin Time! Goldar is with the putties. Zordon has Alpha teleport the Rangers to the Genie to fight. They are immediately overwhelmed and recalled. Zordon give them some advice and sends the Rangers back out. Rita has her monster grow and the Rangers summon their DinoZords. They assemble their zords into the MegaZord but still struggle against the Genie. Alpha discovers the lamp is the source of the Genie's power and tries to dispose of it. Alpha has to slowly increase the power in order to destroy the lamp. Billy and Kimberly use the machine to reverse their body switch, and Bulk and Skull come to return to normal as well.

description: Rita creates her own evil Green Ranger to beat the Power Rangers at their own game.
tags: ['car', 'supervillainess', 'futuristic tank', 'robotic animal', 'hit with a trash can lid', 'brainwashed', 'b sci fi', 'kids family', 'martial arts action', 'superhero action', 'superhero fantasy', 'superhero sci fi', 'team action', 'teen adventure', 'radbug', 'power coin', 'new kid', 'disappearance', 'candle', 'punk teenager', 'putty creature', 'modified car', 'to be continued ending', 'megazord power sword', 'robot monster battle', 'mighty morphin megazord', 'megazord tank', 'tyrannosaurus coin', 'power crystal', 'pterodactyl dinozord', 'sabertooth tiger dinozord', 'triceratops dinozord', 'mastodon dinozord', 'tyrannosaurus dinozord', 'blade blaster', 'power morpher', 'car washing', 'destroyed equipment', 'flying car', 'compact disc', 'magic spell', 'clay creature', 'empress', 'magical staff', 'one against many', 'garbage can lid', 'human versus creature', 'putty patroller', 'crystal ball', 'human skull']
synopsis_with_character_names:
At a martial arts expo in Angel Grove, Jason competes in a karate match with a new boy in town. The new kid is highly skilled and their fight is very close, ending in a draw. They shake hands on a match well done, and Kim is immediately starstruck by the young man. Jason heads to the showers while the others go to the juice bar. On the moon, Rita, watching the fight from above, hatches her latest and greatest plan; to destroy the rangers by creating one of her own.

At school the next day, the new kid steps in when Kim is accosted by Bulk and Skull, scaring them off with his karate skills. Kim thanks him and he introduces himself as Tommy Oliver. She invites him to hang out with her and her friends at the youth center after school, and he happily accepts. Rita begins a ritual, deciding to put Tommy to the test to see if he is worthy to be her ranger. She sends down an entire squad of Putties to ambush him in an alley on his way back from school. Even outnumbered, Tommy is able to defeat all of the putties on his own. Rita is impressed, and abducts him into a pocket dimension, where she starts her ritual. She imbues him with power and bewitches him into becoming her loyal thrall, revealing that she has her own power coin, the Dragon Coin. With the ritual complete, Tommy morphs into Rita's champion: The Green Ranger. Rita gives him his ultimate task, to defeat the Power Rangers. But first, she sends Tommy into the Command Center itself to eliminate Zordon and leave the rangers without support. His power coin granting him access, he disables Alpha with a computer virus, and Zordon realizes that Rita has found someone to give the Dragon Coin to. The Green Ranger declares that Rita will rule supreme, and tears the Command Center apart, breaking Zordon's connection with Earth. Rita is pleased, and begins the next phase of her plan. Deep in the forest, she uses her magic wand to grow Goldar into a giant.

At Billy's garage, the boys are cleaning Billy's flying car, the Radbug. Trini and Kim arrive, Kim looking depressed. Trini tells them that Tommy never showed up to meet Kim after school, and she's worried. The boys encourage her that something probably just came up that prevented him from coming, but just then they get a garbled message from Alpha-5. Their communicators shut down, preventing them from teleporting, and they take the Radbug to the Command Center. They find it in ruins with no power, and Alpha behaving erratically. Billy is able to remove the virus, and the rangers ask him where Zordon is, but Alpha is still on minimal power and has no memory of what happened. Trini points out that no one should be able to break into the Commander Center without a power coin. Just then they see Goldar in the viewing globe, heading for the city. They Morph and go to meet him, fighting off the Putty Patrol and summoning their Zords. The form the Megazord and battle Goldar, who suddenly disappears. Out of nowhere, the Green Ranger jumps onto the Megazord and is able to enter the cockpit, attacking the rangers from inside. The rangers are thrown from the zord, and Green Ranger follows, doing battle with them on the ground. He easily beats the Blue, Yellow, Black, and Pink Rangers all at once, and the Red Ranger challenges him to a one-on-one fight. The Green Ranger wipes the floor with Jason, and blasts all of the rangers with a wave of dark energy.

At the Commander Center, Alpha-5 is struggling to locate Zordon. The Power Rangers are able to teleport away from the battle, demorphed. They are shaken and full of questions, and tell Alpha about the new ranger. Alpha doesn't know anything about a Green Ranger, and suddenly shuts down completely, the remnants of the virus overloading his system. Jason suspects they are only just beginning the real battle, and tells the other rangers that they need to prepare to face Rita and her new ranger again, without Zordon's help.

description: The Power Rangers work to restore Zordon and Alpha, unaware that the new kid in school is actually Rita's evil Green Ranger.
tags: ['car', 'destruction', 'high school', 'supervillainess', 'megazord', 'robotic animal', 'locker', 'cliffhanger', 'evil plan', 'glowing eyes', 'evil laughter', 'capture', 'b sci fi', 'kids family', 'martial arts action', 'superhero action', 'superhero fantasy', 'superhero sci fi', 'team action', 'teen adventure', 'female warrior', 'color in title', 'dark dimension', 'beach', 'sword of darkness', 'robot cockpit', 'mammoth shield', 'balcony', 'dragon power coin', 'putty creature', 'continued from previous episode', 'prisoner', 'shield', 'pterodactyl dinozord', 'sabertooth tiger dinozord', 'triceratops dinozord', 'mastodon dinozord', 'blade blaster', 'magical sword', 'modified car', 'radbug', 'magical weapon', 'human versus monster', 'flying car', 'garage', 'clay creature', 'human versus creature', 'one against many', 'putty patroller', 'garbage']
synopsis_with_character_names:
At the ruined Command Center, the Power Rangers are unable to restore Zordon, and Billy attempts to repair Alpha-5, despite having no experience with the alien technology inside him. Zack remarks that without Zordon, they have no way of knowing who the Green Ranger is, or where he came from. Billy is able to restart Alpha to the team's relief, but the computer is still too damaged to look for Zordon.

On the moon, Rita is basking in her first victory, and prepares to send the Green Ranger down for another attack. Goldar suggest that she give the ranger the Sword of Darkness, a weapon that was taken as a prize from one of Zordon's warriors millennia ago. Now corrupted by Rita's dark magic, it will not only make the Green Ranger more powerful, but will ensure her control over him never wanes. Zordon alone knew about the sword, and without him the Power Rangers will never see it coming. Rita puts Tommy back on Earth to await her next command. Bulk and Skull find him and try to intimidate him into apologizing for confronting them earlier, but his eyes glow and sparks of power send them cowering into a dumpster. At the youth center, Jason trains harder than ever, frustrated that Zordon never told them there was another ranger. Zack asks if he thinks Green Ranger is the one who destroyed the Command Center, and Jason thinks it's too big of a coincidence to ignore. Back at the Command Center, Billy is hard at work trying to repair the main systems. The Green Ranger did serious damage, leaving them without power, teleportation, and communicators. Billy thinks he can fix it given time, but Alpha worries they may not have enough.

Kimberly finds Tommy at school, and asks why he didn't meet her the other day. He behaves coldly to her, and tells her its not her business to worry about him, leaving her confused as to his changed attitude. Rita decides to once again test Tommy's abilities before giving him the Sword of Darkness, and summons him to the coast. She, Goldar, Squat, and Baboo all watch as he battles many Putties, unmorphed. After defeating them, Rita gives him the sword. Tommy swears that the rangers will be destroyed, starting with Jason. Zack and Kim wait at Billy's garage for Jason, so they can all fly to the Command Center in the Radbug. Meanwhile at school, Jason goes to find Tommy and tell him he needs to postpone their plans to train together. Tommy makes a show of understanding, but as soon as Jason's back is turned, Tommy hits him with a ray of energy from the Dragon Coin, making him disappear. Tommy smiles with satisfaction as the Red Ranger is no longer a threat. Jason appears in a dark space, surrounded by barred walls and thick fog at his feet. He tries to break out, but the bars electrocute and stun him back. Zack and Kim can no longer wait, and go to the Command Center without him.

Jason tries to call for help, but the communicators are still down. Goldar appears, and Jason reaches for his morpher, but Goldar has it. Zack and Kimberly make it to the Command Center, where Billy has finished repairing one of the generators, restoring partial power. The viewing globe shows them the Green Ranger has reappeared, and the computer has locked onto him. They decide to morph and try and take him down, but try to keep calling Jason. In Goldar's dark dimension, Jason attacks Goldar in an attempt to get his morpher, but is outmatched against the general without his powers. Goldar taunts him, and Jason keeps trying to attack, but is beaten down. Goldar strikes him, and pins him up against a pillar by the neck, telling him that the only reason he is still alive is because Rita gave Goldar permission to toy with him before killing him. Zack leads the rest of the rangers to attack the Green Ranger. Once again he matches them blow for blow, so they decide to call their zords. Forming the Megazord, they are able to blast the Green Ranger away, for the time being. Rita is furious, but Squat reminds her that she still has Jason. Rita calls for Goldar to finish the Red Ranger off. Goldar calls his sword, telling Jason that its almost time to end his fun.

At the Command Center, the rest of the rangers have won a temporary victory over the Green Ranger, but Alpha still cannot restore Zordon. On top of that, they have not been able to locate Jason, leaving the team extremely worried. Zordon flickers in for a moment, but fades again before he can tell the other what to do. Goldar drops Jason's power morpher and challenges him to grab it, if he dares. Jason distracts Goldar with a kick and lunges for it, but Goldar is too fast, almost cutting Jason's hand off, and kicking him to the ground. Goldar approaches the downed ranger menacingly, and raises his sword to deliver the killing blow.

description: Femme fatale Scorpina joins Rita as the Green Ranger continues to battle the Power Rangers.
tags: ['supervillainess', 'gymnasium', 'mirror', 'reflection', 'b sci fi', 'kids family', 'martial arts action', 'superhero action', 'superhero fantasy', 'superhero sci fi', 'team action', 'teen adventure', 'scorpion', 'dark dimension', 'flashback', 'disappearance', 'putty creature', 'cityscape', 'to be continued ending', 'magical staff', 'mighty morphin megazord', 'eclipse', 'magical sword', 'sword of darkness', 'crossing fingers', 'human versus creature', 'picnic table', 'clay creature', 'putty patroller', 'park', 'crosshair', 'view through telescope', 'male kisses male on the cheek', 'juice bar', 'telescope', 'mushroom', 'color in episode title', 'moon palace', 'prisoner', 'continued from previous episode', 'third part']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Jason, imprisoned in Goldar's dark dimension, lays helpless on the ground as Goldar raises his sword to kill him. At the last second, Jason is able to roll away and dive into the thick fog at their feet, hiding in the mist. Goldar is only too pleased to keep playing with the powerless ranger, and begins stabbing his sword into the ground in search of him. He reminds Jason that there is no way to escape. Rita is pleased that everything is going so well. While Goldar is occupied with Jason, she summons another one of her generals, Scorpina, who joins the Empress of Evil. At the command center, the rest of the teens and Alpha try to lock onto Zordon, but they lose power and he slips away again. Alpha tells them that the computer still hasn't found Jason, and the concerned rangers split up to try and find him.

Goldar gets closer and closer to Jason, coming right up to the hiding ranger. Goldar almost plunges his sword into Jason, who is able to move out of the way in time without being seen. He avoids Goldar temporarily, but is running out of energy. Desperate, Jason attacks Goldar from behind, managing to land a hit, but the monstrous general recovers quickly. When Jason attacks again, Goldar dodges and kicks him down. With nowhere to go, Jason is once again held at swordpoint. At the juice bar, Kim asks Ernie if he's seen Jason. Ernie says he hasn't, but Bulk and Skull offer to "help", in exchange for a kiss. Kimberly tricks them into kissing eachother, and they retreat in horror. Kimberly asks Ernie to keep an eye out, and she runs into Tommy. She asks him about Jason, and Tommy claims that he was supposed to meet him after school, but Jason never came. He mocks Kim for her concern and leaves, passing by and ignoring Zack. Zack and Kim compare notes, but no one has seen their friend. Kim tells Zack what Tommy said, but Zack knows for a fact that Jason went to see Tommy. They decide to go after him and ask him to tell them more. Rita spies on them running after Tommy in the park, and sends a group of putties down to waylay them. Kim and Zack are able to defeat the putty patrollers, but by the time they do, Tommy is gone. Kimberly notes how strange it was that the putties didn't go after the other teen, and they decide to head back to the Command Center.

In the dark dimension, Goldar is about to finish off Jason when the Green Ranger appears and orders him to stop. Rita has decided to let him destroy the Red Ranger personally, and Goldar leaves. The Green Ranger lets Jason get up, and Jason tries to get the Green Ranger to realize that Rita is evil and cannot be trusted, but Green Ranger is determined to serve his queen, and the two fight. Inside the Command Center, Zack and Kim tell Trini that they couldn't find Jason. Billy arrives with good news, he has finished fixing the communicator systems. Now they should be able to locate Jason from the computer and teleport him back, but with only partial power, it will take time to lock onto him. Meanwhile, Jason holds his own against the Green Ranger, for a while. He tries to convince Green Ranger that the rangers should all be on Zordon's side, not Rita's, but the Green Ranger will not hear it, and knocks the tired Jason to the ground. Jason is able to grab his power morpher, but the Green Ranger pins his arm down, and claims victory. At the command center, Billy has to enter Jason's coordinates manually in order to teleport him. The Green Ranger compliments Jason's skills as a warrior, but tells him that the fight is over. He summons the Sword of Darkness and lifts it directly above Jason's heart. Billy finishes inputting the coordinates and teleports Jason just as the sword buries itself into the ground. Jason appears back at the command center exhausted and shaken, but alive. The other rangers are relieved to see him, and he starts to explain what happened.

Goldar chastises the Green Ranger for letting Jason escape, and orders him to remain in the dark dimension and await further orders. Jason fills the others in on what happened to him after talking with Tommy at school. Zack and Kim wonder why Tommy lied about seeing him, but just then the alarm sounds, showing Scorpina on the viewing globe, attacking the city. They morph and go after her, doing battle with her and the Putty Patrol. They drive her back, and Goldar and Rita order her to retreat before she can be destroyed, to her annoyance. Rita sends Goldar to lure the rangers out and form the Megazord, where Rita has a plan to sap away the zord's power with a solar eclipse, leaving it vulnerable. In the dark dimension, the Green Ranger trains furiously, and asks Rita to let him rejoin the fight. She tells him that his time is coming soon, and he keeps training. Rita uses her magic wand to once again grow Goldar into a giant.

At the command center, the Power Rangers try to steel themselves for Rita's next onslaught. The computer finally gets a trace of Zordon, but the signal is too weak to understand what he's saying, and the power starts to wane again. The alarm sounds again, alerting them to Goldar attacking the city. Billy points out that it could be a trap, but Jason says they have no choice but to try and stop him.

description: An eclipse of the sun saps the Megazord's power as Rita's forces launch a full-scale assault on Angel Grove.
tags: ['ice cream', 'giant', 'megazord', 'robotic animal', 'scream', 'b sci fi', 'kids family', 'martial arts action', 'superhero action', 'superhero fantasy', 'superhero sci fi', 'team action', 'teen adventure', 'female warrior', 'color in title', 'sword', 'eclipse', 'disappearance', 'putty creature', 'arthropod', 'to be continued ending', 'identity revealed', 'fissure', 'scorpion stinger', 'solar eclipse', 'megazord power sword', 'claw arm', 'female monster', 'magical staff', 'robot monster battle', 'scorpion monster', 'power crystal', 'power coin', 'pterodactyl dinozord', 'sabertooth tiger dinozord', 'triceratops dinozord', 'mastodon dinozord', 'tyrannosaurus dinozord', 'force field', 'beach', 'gum chewing', 'bus', 'earth tremor', 'juice bar', 'scorpion', 'male nerd', 'clay creature', 'putty patroller', 'sword of darkness', 'dark dimension']
synopsis_with_character_names:
The rangers try to morph, but their morphers short out. Alpha tells them that the effort to locate Zordon is causing a power surge throughout the Morphin Grid, preventing them from transforming. On top of that, they completely lose power again, shutting down the entire command center. Meanwhile, Goldar continues to wreak havoc on the city. Rita plans to use Goldar to lure out the Power Rangers in their Megazord, before blocking out the sun with an eclipse, draining Megazord's solar power.

In the command center, the rangers are stuck in the base, and Alpha is unable to restore the computer. Billy get an idea, and opens up the main console. After a while, he rewires the entire system by hand, fixing the power and reconnecting to the Morphin Grid. The Power Rangers morph, and head out to stop Goldar. They confront the Putty Patrol and Scorpina on the ground, while Goldar tries to crush them under his gigantic heel. The battle causes earthquakes in Angel Grove, forcing Ernie to evacuate the youth center. Bulk and Skull decide to steal a bus to get out of the city.

With power back, the computer finds a trace of Zordon, who tells Alpha how to find him. Alpha sets the computer, but the Green Ranger breaks back into the command center and disables him. Rita arrives to the fight and tells the rangers to surrender. They refuse, so she orders Goldar to take hostages; the bus that Bulk and Skull are in. Jason tells Rita to leave the civilians out of it, but she has Goldar take the bus to the coast. Green Ranger confronts Zordon, who warns him that he will not win while the Power Rangers stand. Green Ranger tells Zordon that Rita has a plan to rule the world, and sends him out the their dimension for good. The rangers follow Goldar to the coast, and are forced to stop and watch as Bulk and Skull's bus is put on the edge of a cliff. Green Ranger is finishing banishing Zordon when Alpha reactivates, his backup system kicking in. He traps Green Ranger in a forcefield, and tries to restore Zordon The Green Ranger is satisfied that his mission was completed. Squat, Baboo, and the putties start to push the bus over the cliff, so the rangers call their zords and form the Megazord. They are able to catch it as it plummets to the ground, and get Bulk and Skull to safety. Goldar attacks Megazord, and Rita sets her plan in motion, casting an evil spell that starts a total eclipse. The Megazord starts to lose power, but the rangers are still able to hold their own against the giant Goldar. Rita grows Scorpina to join him, and the Megazord begins to struggle, continuing to depower. Goldar knocks Megazord down as the sun is completely blocked. On the brink of shutting down completely, Trini tells Jason to call the Power Sword to give them a boost. Meanwhile, Alpha is losing the connection with Zordon while the Green Ranger gloats. The Power Sword temporarily recharges the power cells, giving the rangers an edge against Goldar and Scorpina. Alpha cannot reconnect with Zordon, and is about to use the forcefield to demorph the Green Ranger and find out his identity. Just then, Goldar tells Rita it's time to enact the final phase of their plan, and she teleports the Green Ranger out of the command center and into the fight, growing him into a third giant. The rangers battle him, but are too low on power to defeat him. Scorpina stings the Megazord with her tail, and Goldar and Green Ranger unleash a devastating power attack, which tears the Megazord apart. The rangers are ejected from the cockpit as the remainder of the Megazord falls into a massive fiery crevasse. Jason, Zack, Kimberly, Trini, and Billy are demorphed from the impact, and watch helplessly as one by one, their faithful zords are consumed by the fire and destroyed. Rita rejoices in her victory.

In the command center, Kimberly says that the Power Rangers are finished this time, and Billy says the chances of finding Zordon a second time are next to nothing. Jason will not accept defeat, but Zack and Trini agree that it is hopeless. Suddenly, the computer indicates something to Alpha. He tells the rangers that the computer scanned the Green Ranger's biometrics while he was trapped in the forcefield, and has finally made a match. They look to the viewing globe as the image compiles, and they are shocked to see the true identity of the Green Ranger: Tommy Oliver.

description: The mighty Dragonzord awakens after thousands of years as the Rangers try to break the spell over the Green Ranger once and for all.
tags: ['watching tv', 'supervillainess', 'futuristic tank', 'gymnasium', 'exercise equipment', 'robotic animal', 'b sci fi', 'kids family', 'martial arts action', 'superhero action', 'superhero fantasy', 'superhero sci fi', 'team action', 'teen adventure', 'dragonzord', 'flute', 'sword of darkness', 'dagger', 'dragon dagger', 'slow motion scene', 'mega dragonzord', 'flute dagger', 'power staff', 'handshake', 'power weapon', 'mighty morphin megazord', 'magical sword', 'futuristic pistol', 'blade blaster', 'force shield', 'power sword', 'dual wield', 'megazord power sword', 'megazord tank', 'robot versus robot', 'power crystal', 'zord versus zord', 'sabertooth tiger dinozord', 'pterodactyl dinozord', 'triceratops dinozord', 'mastodon dinozord', 'tyrannosaurus dinozord', 'police car', 'missile attack', 'rooftop', 'wharf', 'juice bar', 'new kid', 'cityscape', 'female monster']
synopsis_with_character_names:
The rangers are in disbelief over the revelation that new kid Tommy is the evil Green Ranger. Alpha-5 suggests it is likely that Rita cast a spell on him to make him do her bidding. Jason tells the team that they cannot give up, for they must save Tommy as well as the rest of the world. On the moon, Rita celebrates success with her minions, and tells Goldar to prepare to lead the final invasion. Without the Megazord to stop them, they are poised the conquer Earth once and for all. Alpha starts to panic that if the rangers give up, evil will win, Rita will rule Earth, and destroy everything in her wake. His point made, Zack, Kimberly, Billy, and Trini agree to keep fighting. Jason says their first priority should be to find Tommy and try to break Rita's curse. They split up to look for him while Alpha tries to locate Zordon.

At the youth center, Ernie watches the TV, showing that a giant Goldar has already begun to attack Earth, though he is confident that the Power Rangers will stop him. Kim arrives and asks if he's seen Tommy. As a matter of fact, the teen is at the youth gym at that very moment, working out. Kimberly goes to him and quietly confronts him about being the Green Ranger. Tommy immediately drops the act, threatening her, and reveals that he knows she is the Pink Ranger. She begs him to come with her so they can break Rita's spell, but Tommy is committed to serving his empress. He warns her to prepare for her and her friends' destruction. Rita finally gives her champion his final weapon, the Dragon Dagger, which can also be used as a flute. With it, he summons his own zord, the Dragon Zord, which rises from it's hiding place under the sea, and under Tommy's command, starts dealing destruction to everything it sees. Alpha is finally able to find a workaround in the computer, and starts a massive sweep to find Zordon. Kim goes to find the other rangers and tell them about her encounter with Tommy, including that he knows their secret identities. Trini runs up and tells them that a giant monster is attacking the Business District. They morph and go to find it, Tommy ordering it to kill them. The Dragon Zord's arsenal is formidable, blasting the rangers off the roof of a building with explosive missiles. They try to get through to Tommy, but Rita's conditioning is too strong. Without their zords, they are powerless to stop his wave of chaos.

At the command center, Alpha-5 is finally able to restore Zordon to his proper place. Zordon tells him that the rangers need to destroy the Sword of Darkness to break the spell over Tommy. He is also able to use his power to bring back the Dino Zords, and teleports the rangers into their respective beasts. Rita is furious, and Jason takes the Tyrannosaurus Zord to fight the Dragon Zord directly. The Red Ranger is able to stun the Dragon Zord long enough for the rest of the team to get to him and form the Megazord. The newly restored Megazord makes short work of Dragon Zord, and disables it. The Red Ranger goes down to battle the Green Ranger one-on-one. The sword and dagger make Tommy a dangerous enemy, but Jason is eventually able to knock the sword out of the Green Ranger's hand. Before he can recover, The Red Ranger disintegrates the Sword of Darkness. The spell is broken, and Tommy demorphs. The other rangers join Jason, and they demorph as Jason goes to help Tommy. Tommy is horrified at the things he's done under Rita's curse, but Jason tells him it was not his fault. He tells Tommy that he alone is in control of the Green Ranger power now, and asks him to join their team. Tommy is at first unsure that he can be trusted, but the others tell him that together, they can stop Rita. He accepts their invitation, and the group all morph as a single unit. Zordon and Alpha celebrate the sixth ranger finally uniting with the Power Rangers. He contacts the team, and tells Tommy how to use the Dragon Flute to control the Dragon Zord and combine it with the Mastodon, Triceratops, and Saber-Tooth Tiger Zords to create the Mega Dragon Zord. Rita is in rage over her defeat, and Goldar swears vengeance on the Power Rangers.

Later, in the command center, the rangers catch up with Zordon. He commends Alpha on his performance during the crisis, and calls Tommy forward to take the Power Ranger oath. Tommy agrees, and Billy presents him with his own communicator. Tommy takes his place on the team, and the six Power Rangers celebrate their victory, and their new friend.

description: Rita demands the Power Rangers hand over their Power Coins if they ever want to see their parents again.
tags: ['megazord', 'box', 'reflection', 'mirror', 'supervillainess', 'overweight', 'robotic animal', 'man wears a suit', 'b sci fi', 'kids family', 'martial arts action', 'superhero action', 'superhero fantasy', 'superhero sci fi', 'team action', 'teen adventure', 'power coin', 'flute', 'crying', 'dragon power coin', 'to be continued ending', 'principal', 'tail attack', 'megazord versus zord', 'robot versus robot', 'robot cockpit', 'power crystal', 'pterodactyl dinozord', 'sabertooth tiger dinozord', 'triceratops dinozord', 'mastodon dinozord', 'tyrannosaurus dinozord', 'dragonzord', 'flute dagger', 'hourglass', 'dark dimension', 'scarf', 'dragon dagger', 'mind control', 'earth tremor', 'overweight woman', 'dagger', 'human versus creature', 'putty patroller', 'handheld mirror', 'putty creature', 'divorced parents', 'mole monster', 'moon palace', 'telescope']
synopsis_with_character_names:
At Ernie's Youth Center, the school is celebrating Parent's Day, with all the ranger's parents in attendance. Jason asks Billy's dad where his son is, and he says Billy is running late from working on a new invention. While all the parents socialize, Trini sees Kimberly's mother arrive with her boyfriend. Kim's mom can't find her, and asks Trini before noticing that Kim's father has also shown up. One of the other kids tells Trini that Kimberly is outside, and Trini goes to find her. On the moon, Rita observes the festivities. She comes up with a plan to abduct all the ranger's parents all at once and use them as leverage to force the rangers to surrender. Finster creates a creature called the Dramole monster to burrow underground and release a hypnotic gas that will incapacitate the adults before kidnapping them. Rita approves, and has the monster sent to Earth. Outside the youth center, Trini finds Kimberly, avoiding going inside. Kim's parents are recently divorced, and Kim feels that it was somehow her fault. Despite Trini's reassurances to the contrary, Kim is worried that since her parents have had no contact since the split, her dad won't even show up to Parent's Day. Trini tells her that both of Kim's parents are already inside, looking for her. This cheers Kim up, but before they can go inside, they are set upon by a large group of Putty Patrollers, who attack them. They hold their own, but are very outnumbered. Alpha-5 sees the situation on the viewing globe, and Zordon calls Jason and Zack to warn them of whats happening outside. Billy still hasn't made it, but the two other rangers run out to help. As they fight, the Dramole burrows its way under the youth center and starts emitting the gas. Everyone inside is suddenly teleported away, including the rangers' parents. Moments later, Billy arrives to the youth center, finding it empty. Rita spies the lone ranger, and has the Dramole engulf him in the hypnotic gas. Rather than kidnap him, she puts him under mind control and orders him to bring her the Dragon Dagger. He obeys, and teleports to the Command Center.

Outside, the Jason, Trini, Kimberly, and Zack defeat the last of the putties. As they make their way back inside, Billy teleports into the command center. He easily disables Alpha, and ignores Zordon's orders to stop. Billy takes the Dragon Dagger, telling Zordon he intends to return it to its "rightful" owner. He teleports away, and the other rangers reenter the deserted youth center. They contact Zordon, who orders them to the command center. He informs them of Billy's unwilling betrayal, and tells them their parents are safe, temporarily. Trini is able to reactivate Alpha, but the rangers are worried sick for their parents, and their friend. Zordon tells them about the Dramole monster, and that Rita plans to wreak havoc on the city using the Dragonzord. He has tracked Billy to Goldar's dark dimension, and the others go to stop him before he can hand over the dagger.

The four rangers morph, and teleport into the dark dimension, where Billy is about to give Goldar the dagger. They try to talk him down, but Rita's mind control is too strong. They attack Goldar, who summons putties to help him fight them. The rangers unsuccessfully try to stop Goldar, but he claims the Dragon Dagger from Billy. With his task complete, the control over Billy ends, and Goldar gloats in his success. He gives the rangers his ultimatum. Surrender their power coins, or he will dispose of their parents. Without the power of the Dragonzord, they will be unable to stop him. He gives them a timer to when they must make their choice, and retreats. Billy is horrified at what he's done, but Jason reminds him it wasn't his fault, and has him morph and rejoin them as they head back to Earth.

Goldar uses the dagger to summon Dragonzord and make it attack Angel Grove. The Power Rangers call their zords, and form Megazord. They battle Dragonzord, but are ultimately defeated. They retreat from the zord, and run into Goldar, who tells them their time is up, and they must make their decision. They contact Zordon for orders, but he tells them they are the only ones who can make such a personal choice. With no alternative, they all agree. One by one, they give up their power coins to Goldar, who puts them in a small chest. Jason demands the return of their parents, but Goldar double crosses them, saying he was never going to release the adults, and the world will be destroyed soon anyway. The rangers are devastated, but are powerless to stop Goldar from taking their coins with him. On the moon, Rita and her goons celebrate.

Zordon teleports the rangers back to the command center. He has located their parents in another dimension, hypnotized and dazed, but he cannot get them back. The rangers lament trusting Goldar to hold up his end of the bargain, but Zordon and Alpha say there was nothing else they could have done, and they made the right choice. Jason reminds his team that they still have one power coin left: the Dragon Coin. Elsewhere, Tommy Oliver arrives at the deserted youth center.

synopsis_with_character_names:
"The Little Black Bag"

A technician, Gillings, is at work in 2098. Gillings is in the time travel division, and he contacts his director, Cosgrove, to tell Cosgrove that one of their time travel experiments inadvertently sent something back in time to 1971: a medical bag. They don't have a way to bring it back.

Two bums, Heppelwhite and former doctor William Fall, are walking through an alley and sit down to share a bottle of wine. They fight over the bottle, and Fall laments how he used to be a man of medicine and is now a wino. Fall explains that 20 years ago he had a problem with the county medical society. He says that he did some fee-splitting and careless misdiagnoses, and did an appendectomy drunk. Searching for scraps in a nearby garbage can, Fall finds the bag and opens it, finding advanced medical equipment inside. He figures that it's worth at least $10 and will let him buy a drink.

Fall and Heppelwhite take the bag to a pawnshop. A Puerto Rican mother comes in and asks for help with her sick daughter, and begs Fall to come help. Fall refuses to sell the bag and goes with the mother, confirms that the girl has a lymphatic infection, and treats her with the equipment from the bag. Fall has the mother step out in the hallway, then finds a card in the bag identifying the girl's infection. He gives the girl the recommended dosage and she instantly recovers. The mother comes back in and hugs her daughter, then blesses Fall. He packs up the bag and goes into the hallway with Heppelwhite. Heppelwhite is disappointed they didn't get paid, but Fall is happy that the mother blessed him and calls him "doctor". Fall wonders how medicine took since gargantuan steps without him knowing it, and finds a 2098 date on the bag's patent label.

Fall and Heppelwhite go to a homeless shelter and Fall works out the bag's medical database, and figures the bag has come from the future. He realizes it can be used to remove cancer, and calls for a homeless man, Charlie Peterson, dying of cancer. Fall tells the shelter manager, Ennis, that he found the bag, and Ennis says that he'll give the bag to the rightful owner if Fall gives it to him. Fall says that he's going to save Peterson, and uses the bag's recommended scalpel to cut out Peterson's cancer without touching the surrounding tissue.

When Ennis tries to intervene, Fall orders him out so the manager gets a policeman. Peterson tells Ennis that he has no more pain, and Fall proudly says that he's a doctor of medicine. Fall goes to the hotel where he stays, with Heppelwhite, and Fall smugly rehearses his future speech to the medical board. He tells Heppelwhite that he's going to solicit one of the most complicated cases from the medical board, and then cure the patient with the bag and says that the scalpel in the bag, if put in his neck, won't kill him. Fall will demonstrate on himself. Heppelwhite wants a part of the action, and explains that Fall will make millions of dollars from the bag while Heppelwhite gets nothing. Fall dismisses Heppelwhite's greed and says that they're going to use the bag to cure the incurable. Heppelwhite takes another scalpel out of the bag and advances on Fall.

Later, a dressed-up Heppelwhite meets with the medical society, posing as Fall. He repeats Fall's speech about embedding the scalpel in his throat and being unharmed. A doctor points out that he's be dead, and Heppelwhite rams the scalpel into his neck.

In 2098, Gillings gets an alert and tells Cosgrove that he's getting an alert that a homicide has been committed with one of the bag's instruments. Cosgrove orders Gilling to deactivate the bag.

After the "demonstration", the doctors of the society leave the room and comment on how Heppelwhite seemingly cut his own throat, and wonders why Heppelwhite didn't just kill himself at home instead of in front of them. One of the orderlies asks what to with the bag, and a doctor tells him to put it in the incinerator. The orderly does so, but first looks inside of it and discovers that the contents have self-destructed.

synopsis_with_character_names:
"Lone Survivor"

A ship makes its way through the fog, and the crew spot a lifeboat ahead with only one survivor in it, a woman. The captain sends another lifeboat to rescue it, and the captain is puzzled because there are no reported sinkings in the area. The fog is too thick to make out the ship's name on the lifeboat. The rescue crew bring the lifeboat to the liner, and the captain sees the name "Titanic" on the lifeboat. The Titanic sank three years ago, and the captain suspects that it's a prank.

The captain goes on deck to see the survivor. The survivor is a man dressed as a woman, and the captain has him taken to the infirmary. There's only a blanket in the lifeboat, and it appears that it's been afloat for three years, when the Titanic sunk.

The ship's doctor check the survivor, and tells the captain when he arrives that the survivor is thin and malnourished, and has frostbite although they are in warm weather. When the survivor wakes up, the captain questions him about what happened to the other passengers, and the name of the ship. The survivor says it was the Titanic, but can't remember his own name. He describes how the Titanic hit an iceberg and sank, and describes it in a sailor's terminology. The captain suggests the survivor dressed as a woman to gain access lifeboat. The survivor says that he doesn't remember. The captain goes, and the survivor asks the doctor if it's 1912. The doctor says that it isn't, and that it's 1915.

Our in the hallway, the doctor asks the captain what's going on. The captain figures that it's a hoax, but the survivor is a sailor and wonders who's service he's in. He figures the survivor was put adrift to draw them off-course during the ongoing war, and they walk past a buoy saying "Lusitania".

The nurse tells the doctor that the survivor won't eat although he appears like he's starving. The doctor goes in to talk to his patient, and the survivor asks what time it is. Once the doctor says it's 8, the survivor says that he was a stoker on the Titanic, and he was in the lifeboat for three years. He insists that it's possible, and tells the doctor that he was so frightened he would have done anything to survive. The survivor says that he tried to get into a lifeboat but they stopped him, so he put on a dress and knocked a half dozen people aside to get into the lifeboat. The lifeboat ropes snapped and capsized, but the survivor hung on and was the only one who did. He remembers the ship's band playing a hymn, and a great wailing. The survivor looked up and saw hundreds of faces at the railing, and then the Titanic went down, leaving nothing but bodies floating on the water.

The doctor insists that there's a rational explanation. The survivor tells him that Lusitania will be hit by a torpedo and will go down in 18 minutes. He figures that he's a Flying Dutchman, damned and doomed to an eternity of lifeboats and rescues.

Later, the doctor finds the captain and tells him what the survivor said. The captain figures that it's poetic justice and points out that why they are condemned along with the survivor. The doctor says that the survivor believes that they're just phantoms peopling the scene, so to speak. The captain isn't convinced, then turns to find the doctor has disappeared along with the lifeboat. He calls the bridge but gets no response, and then disappears himself.

The survivor is still in the sickbay, and runs to the deck and sees a periscope off the starboard bow. He yells a warning but there's no one to hear him. The survivor goes to the bridge and finds no one there, and calls a warning. The torpedo hits the Lusitania, sinking it.

Forty years later, a new ship, the Andrea Doria, spots a lifeboat from the Lusitania and assumes it's a hoax. They send a lifeboat to bring the survivor's lifeboat aboard.

synopsis_with_character_names:
Rose Tyler, a young woman of 19 accidentally trapped one evening in the London department store where she works, finds herself surrounded by plastic mannequins that have come to life in the basement. She is saved by a man who introduces himself as "the Doctor" and tells her to flee the building. He then blows up the transmitter that controlled the mannequins from the store's roof, ravaging the building in the process. The Doctor visits the now unemployed Rose the next day and rescues her from a second attack by a mannequin's arm she had taken home unknowingly, but refuses to give her more explanations.

Rose talks with her boyfriend, Mickey Smith, about her experience, and they find a conspiracy theory website that claims a man fitting the Doctor's description has appeared throughout history. Rose and Mickey visit Clive, the man who runs the website. While Rose is in Clive's house, Mickey is kidnapped by a wheelie bin and replaced with a plastic replicant. When the fake Mickey attempts to question Rose about the Doctor, the Doctor shows up and beheads the replicant. The Doctor takes Rose to his TARDIS, which is disguised as a 20th century police box, and attempts to use the fake Mickey's head to locate the controlling signal. The head melts, but Rose realises that the transmitter must be the London Eye. The Doctor explains to Rose that the fake Mickey was an Auton, controlled by the Nestene Consciousness, and that if he cannot stop it by using a vial of "anti-plastic" liquid, it will destroy all humans on Earth. He also explains to her that he is an alien.

The Nestene Consciousness has taken up residence beneath the London Eye. The Doctor tries to negotiate with it, but it gets angry when he identifies himself as a Time Lord, blaming him for the destruction of its home planet during "the time war." The Nestene Consciousness activates all the autons at the Queens Arcade, where several shoppers are shot dead, including Clive. The Doctor is overpowered by the Autons, but Rose rescues him and drops the "anti-plastic" into the vat where the Nestene Consciousness resided, killing it.

After fleeing the underground complex with Mickey, who was held hostage by the Nestene Consciousness, the Doctor offers Rose more adventures with him. Though Rose initially refuses as she is concerned about her mother and Mickey, she ends up joining the Doctor when he explains that the TARDIS can also travel in time as well as space.

The Dr. and Rose enlist the help of Charles Dickens and a mortician's assistant, Gwyneth (yes, it's Eve Myles) open the infamous Cardiff Rift to allow a seemingly benign race, the Gelf, to come through and make themselves known. description: The Doctor returns Rose to her own time - well, sort of - but her family reunion is ruined when a spaceship crashes in the middle of London. What is the origin of the spaceship, and where has the Prime Minister gone in this time of crisis?

synopsis_with_character_names: Rose and the Doctor return 12 months vs. 12 hours after Rose first left and mom is upset, to say the least. Out of nowhere a spaceship crash lands in the Thames and "hefty" politicians become host bodies for the Family Slitheen. The Doctor is called to Number Ten Downing Street as an alien specialist and along with Rose and Harriet Jones (a minor politico, but one to watch). A small boy paints Bad Wolf on the side of the Tardis, later the boy is seen cleaning the graffiti off as the Dr. admonishes him to never paint graffiti again. Dr. Toshiko Sato (Torchwood) makes her first appearance as the doctor in charge of a porcine alien autopsy.

description: The Slitheen have infiltrated Parliament and have the Doctor and his friends trapped as the Doctor works to prevent them from starting World War Three.

synopsis_with_character_names:
Every human in the briefing room is electrocuted, but the Doctor isn't human, and he manages to remove his card and slap it onto the exposed Slitheen's electronic collar. The feedback incapacitates not only this Slitheen, but all the others. Upstairs, Harriet and Rose bolt for the door as the Slitheen that was Margaret Blaine goes into spasm; elsewhere, Mickey bursts into Jackie's flat and pulls her to safety, pausing only to snap a picture of the writhing Slitheen that was Commissioner Strickland with his cellphone.

The Doctor bolts out of the briefing room to fetch help, but Green manages to pull the ID card away from his fellow Slitheen's collar, and by the time the Doctor returns with a team of soldiers, it has disguised itself as General Asquith again. Sergeant Price examines the experts' bodies and confirms that they're dead, and Green accuses the Doctor of killing them. The Doctor in turn accuses Green of being an alien in disguise, but the soldiers don't buy it. The Doctor tries to flee, but soldiers surround him in the corridor outside, and Asquith orders them to execute him on the spot; fortunately, they've backed him up against a lift, and he pops inside and closes the doors before they can shoot. Asquith places the upper levels of 10 Downing Street under strict quarantine and orders Price to secure the ground floor and shoot the Doctor on sight. In the meantime, Asquith and Green head upstairs - and on the way, they dispose of their flatulent human disguises to revel in their glorious nudity.

Upstairs, Harriet realises that they've left the emergency protocols in the Cabinet room, but the Slitheen-Margaret has recovered and they are unable to return for them. The Doctor's lift stops briefly on the floor, distracting the Slitheen for a moment and enabling Harriet and Rose to hide in a nearby office. The Doctor takes the lift up one more floor and then descends via the staircase. Green and Asquith join Margaret, eager to purify their blood with a hunt; Margaret can scent the fear of her targets, and has been prolonging the hunt deliberately to make the smell more intoxicating. Margaret pulls aside the curtains to reveal Rose hiding behind them, but Harriet emerges from hiding, offering herself up in the young woman's place. Fortunately, the Doctor bursts in and drives the Slitheen back with a fire extinguisher, enabling them all to escape.

Harriet leads the Doctor back to the Cabinet room to fetch the emergency protocol booklet, but the Slitheen are only a few steps behind them. The Doctor holds them off with a bottle of port, threatening to use his sonic screwdriver to triple its flammability. When the Slitheen hesitate, he takes the opportunity to question them, and learns that they are not an invasion force, but a family business. Slitheen is not their race name, but their surname; "Joseph Green" is in fact Jocrassa Fel-Fotch Pasameer-Day Slitheen. Before the Doctor can learn their intentions for the Earth, however, "Asquith" calls his bluff regarding the port. As the Slitheen advance on him, the Doctor delivers a brief lecture on the history of 10 Downing Street... up to the installation of three-inch-thick steel security bulkheads, which he now activates, sealing the Slitheen out of the room. And, unfortunately, sealing himself and his friends inside.

Satisfied that the Doctor no longer poses a threat, the Slitheen summon the rest of the family to Downing Street, and Asquith orders Price to keep the ground floor secure and await an emergency address from the Acting PM to the people of the world. Outside, Andrew Marr tries to make sense of the variety of people who are showing up: Group Captain Tennant James of the RAF; Ewan McAllister, Deputy Secretary for the Scottish Parliament; and Sylvia Dillaine, Chairman of the North Sea Boating Club ("Quite what connects all these people, we have no idea"). All they seem to have in common is their remarkable girth and the fact that they've been invited to the upper levels of 10 Downing Street. Upstairs, the Slitheen strip off their skin-suits, and soon, the entire family has gathered, except for Sip Fel-Fotch, the one posing as Strickland, who has yet to finish with Jackie Tyler...

Mickey helps Jackie to slip back to his flat, unnoticed. There, he warns her that nobody can be trusted (casting a suspicious glance at his trash bin as he does so), and accuses the Doctor of dragging Rose into this dangerous lifestyle. Jackie begins to cry as the shock settles in, realising that the man she accused of killing her daughter has now saved her life - and that the monster that tried to kill her is still out there somewhere. Outside, Strickland sniffs the air and dismisses the other police, telling them that he'll finish with Jackie on his own...

In the Cabinet room, the Doctor places the PM and Ganesh's bodies in the cupboard, and Harriet sadly realises that she never knew the young secretary's name. The Doctor explains that the Slitheen's collars generate compression fields that enable them to shrink their bodies down to fit inside human skins; the gas is a side effect, and the PM's body was too slim for them to use as a disguise. It occurs to him that he knows Harriet Jones' name from somewhere, but he can't recall exactly where. Harriet reads the emergency protocol booklet but finds nothing of any help; Rose suggests that they launch a missile at the Slitheen, but due to an unfortunate incident in the UK's past, the United Nations holds the release codes for Britain's nuclear arsenal, and they can't launch a strike without UN approval. Mickey then calls Rose, and is able to reach her through the steel shielding thanks to the modifications the Doctor made to her cellphone. The Doctor swallows his pride and asks Mickey for help, giving him the secret password ("buffalo") that will enable him to log onto UNIT's secure website. As Mickey works, however, Jackie demands to know whether her daughter will be safe with the Doctor - and the Doctor is unable to answer her question.

The UNIT website is monitoring an alien signal that the Doctor realises is being transmitted by the Slitheen. As the Doctor listens to the signal and tries to work out what it's saying, Strickland tracks Jackie down to Mickey's flat, strips off his skin-suit and begins to break down the door. Mickey offers to hold off Sip Fel-Fotch with a baseball bat while Jackie flees, but there's no other way out of the flat. For a moment, the Doctor is paralysed by indecision, but when Rose begs him to help her mother, he springs into action and starts looking for the aliens' weakness. He and his allies list all they know about the aliens, from the colour of their skin to the nature of their technology, the smell of their farts and, finally, the use of a hyphenated surname. This enables the Doctor to narrow down their planet of origin to Raxacoricofallapatorius, which means that the aliens' bodies are composed of organic calcium, weakened by the gas compression field - which leaves them vulnerable to acetic acid. Mickey and Jackie retreat to the kitchen, where Jackie pours all of Mickey's pickled onions, gherkins, and eggs into a container and flings it at the approaching Sip Fel-Fotch. He blinks in surprise for a moment and then explodes, coating Mickey's kitchen with a wet sludge. In the Cabinet rooms, Harriet recalls how Hannibal used vinegar to dissolve boulders while crossing the Alps, and she, Rose and the Doctor share a victory toast.

The death of Sip Fel-Fotch hits the other Slitheen hard, and Green storms out of Downing Street to speak to the press. Mickey and Jackie watch the live broadcast on TV while the Doctor, Harriet and Rose listen over Mickey's cellphone. Outside, Green addresses the nations of the world, claiming that Earth is under attack by hostile alien forces capable of unleashing massive weapons of destruction within 45 seconds; Britain lies directly beneath the mothership, and their only hope of survival is an immediate nuclear strike. Green thus begs the UN to pass an emergency resolution and release Britain's missile codes so they can strike first and save the planet.

The Doctor, finally understanding the truth, opens the bulkheads to speak to Margaret and confirm his suspicions. The Slitheen deliberately engineered a spectacular UFO crash in order to drive the world into a panic and convince the UN to release the nuclear codes. Once the Slitheen have those codes, they'll fire Britain's nuclear arsenal at every other country on Earth, triggering World War Three. Despite the showy splash-landing, the Slitheen's ship didn't actually crash; it's just parked, and the Slitheen intend to sit out the nuclear holocaust inside. Once the planet has been reduced to a radioactive cinder, the Slitheen will sell off bits of it as fuel to every cut-price, bargain spaceship out there. The signal they're sending out is an advertisement for the sale of the century; they'll make a hefty profit, at the cost of five billion lives. The Doctor orders the Slitheen to leave the planet immediately, or he'll stop them. Margaret and the Slitheen burst out laughing - but the Doctor isn't laughing, and as he closes the bulkheads, Margaret begins to get a little worried.

It's midnight in New York, and the UN Security Council have convened to vote on their emergency resolution. Dawn is breaking over London, and as far as anybody knows, it could be the day humanity fights its first interplanetary war. Green and Asquith leave Price in charge of keeping the ground floor secure, while they retreat to the Prime Minister's office to wait for the phone to ring. Giggling with anticipation, the Slitheen remove their skin-suits to greet victory in their glorious nudity.

Time is running out, and the Doctor reluctantly reveals that he can stop the Slitheen - but he can't guarantee Rose's safety. Rose is willing to let him do whatever he has to, but Jackie refuses to let him risk her daughter's life. The Doctor finally tells Jackie that this is what his life is about, standing up and making terrible decisions - and he doesn't want to lose Rose because of it. But Harriet then points out that she's the only duly elected representative in this room, and she's thus the only one with the authority to make this decision. On behalf of the people of Britain, she orders the Doctor to carry out his plan. The Doctor thus directs Mickey over the phone, giving him the passwords he needs to hack into the Royal Navy and launch a conventional, non-nuclear missile from the nearest offshore submarine, the HMS Taurean. Jackie can't bring herself to stop Mickey, as much as he himself might want her to... and Mickey, albeit reluctantly, presses the button and fires the missile at 10 Downing Street. The Doctor, Rose and Harriet remain trapped in the Cabinet offices, and the bulkheads may not be strong enough to protect them from a direct missile strike; nevertheless, the Doctor keeps in touch with Mickey, guiding him as he blocks the counter-defences on the coast, enabling the missile to slip through. Rose and Harriet clear all of the loose objects out of the cupboard, and they and the Doctor huddle inside and wait...

Downstairs, Price receives a report of the incoming missile, and triggers the fire alarm, evacuating the building. He rushes upstairs to warn the Prime Minister of the danger - and bursts into the office to find it filled with naked Slitheen, waiting for the red phone to ring. After an appalled pause, Price flees. Outside, the press and police scatter as the missile hurtles towards Downing Street; inside, the panic-stricken Slitheen begin fighting over their skin-suits, but they're trying to work out which disguise belongs to whom when the missile strikes, blowing 10 Downing Street to smithereens. The steel box that was the Cabinet room tumbles end over end into the street, and the Doctor, Rose and Harriet emerge, alive and intact. When Price rushes up to investigate, Harriet immediately takes charge, ordering him to contact the UN and inform them that the crisis is over. The Doctor and Rose watch happily as Harriet addresses the press, telling them that the human race has survived the crisis undefeated. She's come a long way from the flustered backbencher she was yesterday - and the Doctor now knows where he recognised her name. Harriet Jones is going to be a future three-term Prime Minister, the architect of Britain's forthcoming golden age.

Rose returns home for a tearful reunion with her mother, while the Doctor returns to the TARDIS and disperses the Slitheen's signal before any interested parties can pick it up. Jackie still doesn't trust the Doctor, but she's now willing to listen and learn more about Rose's new life. When the Doctor calls Rose on her cellphone and learns that Jackie has invited him to dinner, he turns the invitation down without hesitating and instead offers Rose a choice: stay home with her mother, or come with him to see things she's never seen before. When Jackie finishes making tea in the kitchen, she finds Rose packing up her belongings - and, though she tearfully begs her daughter to stay, Rose continues packing.

Night falls over London, and the Doctor forces the young boy who spray-painted "BAD WOLF" onto the TARDIS to scrub it clean again. Mickey has bought a newspaper, and is upset to find that the alien attack is already being dismissed as a hoax; it's almost enough to make him agree with the Doctor that humans are all idiots. The Doctor concedes that Mickey's not as bad as he thought, and gives him a CD-ROM containing a virus that will erase all mention of the Doctor from the Internet, thus ensuring that nobody can get into trouble by following him. He also invites Mickey to accompany him and Rose, but Mickey admits that he can't handle the pace of the Doctor's life. He asks the Doctor not to tell Rose, however, and when Rose shows up and invites Mickey to join them, the Doctor speaks up, stating that Mickey isn't invited. Jackie, upset, pleads with Rose to stay, but Rose assures Jackie that she's just going off travelling for a while - and, since she's travelling in a time machine, she can be back in ten seconds no matter how long she spends out there. She and the Doctor step into the TARDIS, which dematerialises as Jackie and Mickey watch. Ten seconds pass, and the TARDIS does not return. Upset, Jackie returns to her flat... while Mickey settles down with the newspaper to wait a while longer.
