description: When Omega Chi has a party to celebrate Evan's saving them from the new restrictions Cappie decides Kappa Tau must have a competing party but they are broke. Casey makes Rebecca the Sober Sister to keep here from going to Cappie's party instead. Rusty must decide how to break up with Tina when he decides a sex only relationship is not all he wants. Evan makes Calvin k... Read all
tags: ['party', 'vomiting', 'jealousy', 'gay kiss', 'gay', 'drinking', 'dorm life', 'dancing']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Rusty is trying to figure out his relationship with Tina. He doesnt understand why all she wants is sex.

Rusty meets up with his brothers and tries to figure out what kind of relationship hes in with Tina. Girlfriend, or friends with benefits? Cappie explains to Rusty that hes in a friend with benefits relationship and that he should be happy about it.

Cappie sees Evan outside the liquor stores and finds out that he is having a six way party with all the Greek houses on campus. Every house was invited but Kappa Tau. Cappie decides that he needs to have his own party despite lack of money, beer, and time.

Rusty goes to the ZBZ house looking for his sister for more advice. Rusty tells his sister that he needs to talk about sex. With the situation being too awkward, Casey recruits Ashley to help her out, and to talk to Rusty. But, the advice wasnt enough for Rusty. He talked to Beaver afterward, and he told him just to ignoring her for a few days, and she would just go away.

Back at the ZBZ house, Rebecca, and a few pledges want to attend the Kappa Tau party instead of the Omega Chi party. Even though they were formally asked to attend. Casey decided that instead of banning the girls from going to the KT party. That giving them the job of sober sisters for the event would keep them in line.

At Omega Chi, the party is in full swing. Evan notices many guys giving Casey attention. Evan asks his brother Calvin to look after Casey and make sure she doesnt get too close to any other guys, keeping the field open for him. Calvin has invited Michael to the party at his frat house. Michael does not seem impressed, and also very uncomfortable telling Calvin he had nothing in common with frat guys.

Ashley has already gotten several phone numbers and Casey with none, thanks to Evan and Calvin. Finally the guy Casey had been eyeing all night had come up to her, and started talking. Casey found out that the universe had finally answered her call knowing now that the guy she though was taken was now available.

Rebecca decides that shes not going to wait for permission to go to the Kappa Tau party. Instead, she puts on party clothes, and phones the other pledges to meet her.

Tina is still bombarding Rusty with phone calls and messages. The Kappa Tau party is dead and Cappie has come up with an idea to steal the party from the Omega Chi, along with the alcohol.

Casey is starting to get suspicious with Calvins behavior and wants to know whats going on. Calvin gives her a lane excuse, and walks away quickly. While on the way out, Calvin tells Evan that hes done with chasing after Casey. Evan then approaches Casey and asks her when things calm down if they could have a dance as friends. Casey accepts.

Behind the scenes Cappie and his brothers are in the Omega Chi house, stealing all the liquor they can.

Calvin finally catches up with his date and it is apparent that he wants to get out of there. Calvin is left standing there, while his date goes to get another drink.

Cappie, corners Casey at the Omega Chi party, and asks her why no Zeta Betas had shown up. Casey explains to Cappie, the reason none of them went is because they had already gotten an invitation from Omega Chi and that, the Kappa Tau had thrown theirs together at the last second. Cappie reminds Casey about the Great Gatsby party and how much the Kappa Taus helped. Casey explains that the ZBZs and the Omegas had made up, and that maybe in three weeks the KT and the ZBZ would have an outing together. Cappie then runs off, without saying goodbye for fear of getting caught by Evan, who is not so far away. Rusty is still in line for the bathroom, and lets a pretty girl cut in front of him. She also gives him some advice on how to dump Tina.

When Cappie gets back to the KT house, his arms are full of liquor, and Rebecca is waiting for him.

Evan sees Casey and her new male friend talking and holding hands. It seems like Evan has finally given up, and goes to find himself a drink.

Calvin goes to find his date, and they finally confront each other about what is really going on. Calvin thought the reason Michael was so uncomfortable was because he thought his brothers where homophobic, but really he was only uneasy because Michael felt so much older than everyone else. Calvin and Michael made up with a kiss.

Evan is sitting on the coach when Frannie sits down beside him. Evan spills about his feelings for Casey, and even tells Frannie, about his past attempts to keep guys away from Casey, so that he could make his move. Frannie tells Evan that instead of chasing after Casey he should find a girl to chase after him.

Casey finds out the Rebecca is not on duty, and that she will have to leave the party to deal with one of the girls, who has gotten way too drunk. Casey has to leave her new love interest but tell him shell be back soon.

Back at Rustys dorm, Rusty starts writing an email to break it off with Tina. Although he cant quite find the right words, and decides to scraps the idea.

Casey goes over to the KT house, to get Rebecca to do her job as a pledge. Although Rebecca refuses to, Casey tries to get Cappies help, but he opted out of getting in between Casey and Rebeccas fight. Casey ended up having to take her drunken sister back the ZBZ house. On her walk back, Ryan the boy she had met at the Omega house had found her. Casey apologized for everything that happened that night, but Ryan said, it was okay and that he had a great time anyways. They then both leaned in and kissed except he kissed a little too much, with his mouth fully open leaving Casey with slobber all over her face.

Back at KT the party is going fierce. Rusty has finally broken up with Tina via text message with his frat brothers help. Tina then messaged Rusty back, letting him know that she was fine but that she had Crabs.

description: Part 1: When Icarus Base is attacked, its inhabitants are forced to flee through the Stargate. The base was created on a distant planet to take advantage of a powerful energy supply located there. Their goal is to try to determine the purpose of the mysterious ninth symbol of the Stargate, which they've never been able to lock in. In going through the Stargate, they a... Read all
tags: ['disorganization', 'soldier', 'female soldier', 'male soldier', 'torture', 'genocide', 'photon torpedoes', 'sex with alien', 'implosion', 'shuttle craft', 'romulan', 'captain', 'starship', 'vulcan', 'aerial combat', 'death threat', 'equation', 'railgun', 'flashback', 'recruiting', 'mathematical problem', 'evacuation', 'suicide mission', 'self sacrifice', 'escape', 'alien attack']
synopsis_with_character_names:
A space ship flies through space. Inside there are halls empty and dark. Eventually there is a large room containing a stargate. The gate begins to come alive and eventually a wormhole forms lighting up the room with its light. A military man carrying a gun comes tumbling quickly through the gate. He quickly recovers and scans the room for danger. Then someone else comes tumbling through the gate. He runs over to check on them an is almost hit by a suitcase which comes flying through the gate. More and more people and luggage begin to come through the gate at a breakneck pace, energetically tumbling most of them go sprawling. The man uses his radio "This is Lt Scott, slow down the evac, we are coming in too hot!" A woman grabs Lt Scott and demands to know where they are and why they haven't come through to Earth. Someone calls for a medic, but she's already at work treating someone. A thin man in civilian clothes ascends a staircase and calmly watches the chaos from above. Finally, after the flow of bodies has slowed down a last man comes hurtling through the gate, literally flying through the air. He crashes hard on the deck and Lt Scott and medic, TJ, go to check on him. As the injured man, Colonel Young, passes out he tells Scott "You're in charge".

We flash back to see Eli Wallace, a young slacker, bragging to his friend about how he is going to solve the Dakarran weapons puzzle in an MMORPG called Prometheus. However, when Eli inputs his solution to the puzzle the game simply reboots. Disappointed, Eli is visited the next day by Colonel Jack O'Neill and Dr Nicholas Rush who congratulate him on solving the puzzle and attempt to recruit him. Believing this to a be a joke, Eli refuses and shuts the door in their faces. He is then beamed aboard the space ship General Hammond, which is orbit above Earth preparing to head to the planet Icarus. Rush explains that they had put the Dakaran weapons puzzle in the game as a test to try and recruit people. Rush is the head of a project trying to dial the "ninth chevron" on the Stargate and promises that if Eli joins them that the government will take care of Eli's mother's medical bills. On the trip to Icarus, Eli watches a video which informs him of the history of the Stargate and befriends Chloe Armstrong, an aide to the Senator from California who is traveling to Icarus for oversight reasons.

Returning to the space ship we see the various casualties being treated as well as the desire of everyone but Rush to return home. While unconscious, Young has a memory of his leaving for the assignment, something which puts strain on his marriage. He has a seizure.

In flashback we see the General Hammond arriving at Icarus. Colonel Young calls Lt Scott to escort the arriving dignitaries and Scott breaks off a sexual encounter with a fellow airman to comply. Rush reveals that Eli's solution to the Dakaran weapons puzzle will allow them to finally dial the ninth chevron. However, when the solution is tried it fails to work for an unknown reason.

On the ship, Scott tries to organize the survivors and reveals to them that the life support systems on the ship are failing making the air become more toxic.

On Icarus, Rush puzzles over why the solution failed to dial the gate. During a dinner to welcome Senator Armstrong, the base comes under attack from the Lucian Alliance.

On Destiny, Rush has a showdown with Eli and Marine Masterseargant Ronald Greer over Rush's attempt to turn on the live support system. We see TJ tending to Colonel Young and she has a flashback to Icarus where she revealed her intention to leave the service.

On Icarus, during the attack, things are becoming critical, the attack has made it so the planet is about to explode. However, Rush still wants to try dialing the ninth chevron since this may be their last chance. After a suggestion from Eli he manages to dial the ninth chevron address rather than the planned evacuation to Earth. Rush informs Young of his decision and justifies it by saying that if the planet explodes while the wormhole is connected any blast energy could be transferred to Earth. They attempt to shut down the gate but cannot. Angry, but with no other options, Young orders the evacuation to the ninth Chevron address, telling everyone to take as much of the expedition equipment as they can.

On the ship, they turn on the computer systems. Doing so they discover that the ship is called Destiny and also discover a map showing that it has traversed dozens of galaxies over millions of years and that they are "several billion light years from home".

On Icarus, the people evacuate, carrying expedition equipment with them. Young is the last one through, an explosion sending him flying through the gate.

On Earth, Colonel Carter, who had been directing the space defense of Icarus, learns that the evacuees did not arrive on Earth and wonders where they are.

synopsis_with_character_names:
Sgt. Spencer is late for his shift of kitchen duty but when Sgt Greer goes to check on him, he finds Spencer dead. Although it appears to be a suicide, no gun is present. Wray berates Col. Young for pressuring Spencer but Greer intervenes and reminds her that Spencer could not have committed suicide then gotten rid of the gun. Young orders an investigation led by Lt. Scott and Eli Wallace who have solid alibis. Eli and Lt. Scott begin to search all of the rooms while the rest of the ship's group stay in the gate room. Rush communicates with Col Young and it is realized that Rush is not in the gate room with everyone else. Lt. Scott and Eli then find the gun used to kill Spencer and find it in an air vent in Col. Young's cabin. Col. Young insists that the investigation continue and refuses suggestions that he maintain leadership through force. They report the situation to earth and Wray is put in charge by the IOA to conduct an investigation and hearing. Col. Young asks Chloe Armstrong to defend him in the questioning.

As tensions escalate, Lt. Scott continues to pressure Eli to search for any leads or information that may have been recorded on the kinos Eli has roaming around the ship. Many of the crew feel no loss as a result of Spencer's death and some consider it a good act of leadership by Col. Young but Young continues to refuse to pull rank and stop the investigation. Wray assumes command and gives Rush permission to run the science team as he sees fit. Rush immediately brings the scientists into the room where he found the interface chair in the prior episode and gives them a speech about how it is vital that they find a way to interact with the chair since it may be their only chance to return home. Eventually, one of the scientists on duty convinces Eli to go get some food and while alone, attempts to sit in the chair (or Rush may have forced him, it is unclear). The chair inserts needles into his head and he is removed from the chair in a very serious medical condition. It is not known if he will survive or whether he gained any knowledge.

The Destiny drops back into normal space and a gate is opened to a desert world. Some crew go through to investigate and find a crashed alien spaceship of a race no one is familiar with. Meanwhile, Eli finds that some records on the kino were erased. He retrieves the records and shows everyone proof that Spencer killed himself. Later, he privately shows Young that it was Rush who took the gun and hid it in Young's cabin. Young and Rush go to the planet to see the alien ship. Everyone else returns and Young has a confrontation with Rush. They fight and Young leaves Rush on the planet as he returns back through the stargate just before Destiny jumps again. He tells everyone that Rush fell in a rockslide and did not make it. The episode ends with Rush awakening on the desert planet all alone.

description: Col. Young returns to the Destiny having left Dr. Rush on the planet below. Some are dubious about his explanation and Camile puts Young on notice that her own report may cast doubt on his motives. When he tries to use the communication stones to report back to Earth, he is transferred in to a being on a alien ship. He returns safely but they soon come under attack wh... Read all
tags: ['soldier', 'female soldier', 'male soldier', 'rescue', 'alien encounter']
synopsis_with_character_names:
In "Space" Dr. Wray (Ming Na), of the IOA, confronts military leader Colonel Young (Justin Louis a.k.a. Louis Ferreira) about making an honest report to Washington. In "Justice," his return to the Destiny, without lead scientist, Dr. Rush (Robert Carlyle) gave rise to speculation that Young had left Rush for dead or had killed him.

When Young attempts to communicate with home, using the ancient stones, he finds himself aboard an alien space ship. This is the first encounter with the blue-grey aliens (CGI).

In space, Destiny encounters hostile aliens, who communicate one word in English, "Surrender," after Eli Wallace (David Blue) sends a greeting in Ancient language. Aliens attack and the first space battle ensues between spaceships. Destiny sends the shuttle, piloted by Lt. Scott (Brian J. Smith). One of the alien crafts attaches itself to Destiny and drills through the hull. Chloe Armstrong (Elyse Levesque) investigates the sound and is abducted.

Young deduces his aliens-of-the-stones and the hostile attacks are the same aliens. He uses the stones again to gain intel on their ship. Amid rising crew-speculation of Young's subterfuge regarding Rush, Young "visits" the alien ship and discovers Dr. Rush and Chloe have been captured. In the alien's body, he breaks Dr. Rush out of his liquid-suspension-tank. Together, they head to Chloe, when the stone-connection is terminated.

Young gives orders to fire weapons on the alien craft, despite two members being aboard. Meanwhile, Rush saves Chloe; they escape and return to Destiny. Rush corroborates Young's version of 'Rush's being buried under a rock slide,' although speculation remains regarding Young's abandonment of Rush on the deserted planet.

Young and Rush confront each other about their mutual attempts to get rid of each other. Young admits he regrets losing control and the loss of the crew's confidence. They state they'll pretend nothing happened, "for the sake of the crew."

Lt. Johansen refuses a crew-distilled alcoholic beverage. Surrepticiously, Rush and Wray meet, speaking frankly about Young being dangerous.

description: Now safely returned to the Destiny, both Chloe and Dr. Rush are having nightmares about their period of captivity. Rush believes that the aliens are only after one thing - the Destiny itself. They find a tracking device attached to the underside of the ship and manage to destroy it. Rush and Camile Wray however are concerned at Col. Young's actions and decide to prote... Read all
tags: ['soldier', 'female soldier', 'male soldier', 'escape', 'surgery', 'insurrection', 'flashback']
synopsis_with_character_names: "Divided" could also be called, "Mutiny on the Destiny" because the scientists under leadership of Dr. Rush (Robert Carlyle) and civilians, under Dr. Camille Wray (Ming Na) team up to take control of the Ancient's spaceship, Destiny. This occurs while repairs are being made, jeopardizing Col. Young (Justin Louis) and Lt Scott (Brian J. Smith) who are in a shuttle with docking problems. Eli Wallace (David Blue) supports the military side over Dr. Rush, and is offended by Chloe Armstrong (Elyse Levesque) when he believes she purposefully distracted him in order to aid the mutinous crew gain control. TJ (Alaina Huffman) is inadvertently caught on the non-military side of the Destiny and held prisoner. She reminds the crew that Young is a long time soldier and mutinies are 'acts of war" and "war" is what they do. Young outstrategizes Dr. Rush and followers and retakes the ship. He regains his leadership integrity when he instructs his successful military followers to get along with the perpetrators of the take-over.

description: Now firmly in control again, Col. Young and the other military personnel try to find a way to live with the civilians who tried to take control of the ship. When the Destiny prematurely comes out of hyper-space due to a computer glitch, they find both a sun and an Earth-like planet that should not be there. Rush concludes that the entire system was created by an alien... Read all
tags: ['soldier', 'female soldier', 'male soldier']
synopsis_with_character_names: "Faith" moves SGU away from the dark themes of the other episodes to a more upbeat theme of whether there is "Someone" out there watching over them, or whether it is just chance that good or bad things happen. The crew receives some R and R, a much needed change of pace when the Destiny drops out of FTL (faster than light speed) at a point where there is no record of a solar system. However, there is a 200 million year old sun and a verdant lush planet, similar to earth. With a sun that young, the planet should have been a molten mess. It appears it was terra formed. Many believe that it is evidence that there are beneficent aliens who are watching over them. The terra formed planet provided for them, just when they needed it, seems too coincidental to be chance (for many). With a chance for some clean air, sun, fragrant meadows, the replenishment of their food and plantings for medicinal reasons, its allure makes many of the away team say they would rather stay on the planet than return to Destiny. TJ (Alaina Huffman) is included in those wanting to stay behind on the planet, as she reveals that she is pregnant and doesn't want to give birth or raise a child on the Destiny. Lt. Scott (Brian J. Smith) guesses the father is Col. Young (Justin Long) and Chloe becomes her supporter when she finds out. Young and Rush (Robert Carlyle) join forces in insisting that everyone return to the ship. The lines are blurring with sides no longer being military, scientist and civilian. The planet seems deserted until they find an obelisk (extraordinarilly tall) that sends a radiation beam into space. It points to intelligent design and the presence of someone living there before they showed up. Nothing was found to clear up who it would be.

description: Dr. Rush relives his past life by sitting in the alien chair in an attempt to download critical data. A university professor, his wife's cancer returns and he is recruited by Dr. Daniel Jackson for what will be called the Icarus project. He's avoiding dealing with his wife's situation and throws himself into his work. In his dream-like state, he's trying to make sense... Read all

synopsis_with_character_names:
Sgt Ronald Greer (Jamil Walker Smith), Chloe Armstrong (Elyse Levesque), Lt. Matthew Scott (Brian J. Smith) and Eli Wallace (David Blue) escape the tunnel cave-in that left them stranded on the planet when Destiny jumped to FTL. However, in the search for an exit, Greer is separated from the other three, who find their way to the stargate and go through a succession of stargates in hopes to find one in proximity to where Destiny will next drop out of FTL.

They end up on the deserted planet where Dr. Rush (Robert Carlyle) and Colonel Everett Young (Louis Ferreira aka Justin Louis) fought below the crashed alien ship, having gone the opposite direction of Destiny's flight plan. They use the information on the crashed ship to find their way back to the flight plan of Destiny but are too late. Destiny jumps to FTL and they are stranded on the planet which was in proximity to the ship for a short while.

Greer, abandoned by his comrades, hallucinates about his troubled past with an abusive, alcoholic, ill father. It explains why Greer is the way he is, both heroic as a young man who survives and saves his parents in a fire as well as being the angry young man, such as when he reacts negatively to Eli's casual "Scared?" remark.

Greer is rescued by 2nd Lt Vanessa James' team and returns to the ship but refuses to share his experience with Sgt. Hunter Riley who is picking up Eli's tradition of recording everything on the Kino. TJ (Alaina Huffman) informs Young that she is pregnant. Rush works on the problems of recovering the lost crew and determining what to do when the Destiny, which is close to leaving the galaxy, without enough power to help them survive, makes that final jump.

description: The Destiny has jumped into hyperspace and is now traveling through an inter-galactic void. They've also been unable to locate Eli, Chloe and Scott who have been left behind. synopsis_with_character_names:
(This episode is not due to air for a week. I downloaded it. It was in Russian. The English soundtrack was faintly audible in the background.)

The episode begins with an escalating fight between a male crew member and female crew member Lt. Vanessa James (Julia Benson). She throws a lantern and kills him with that blow to the head. The scene ends with his head lying on the floor in a pool of his own blood.

Later, Dr. Volker (Patrick Gilmore) is wandering the corridors. Background music is similar to Atmospheres from 2001: A Space Odyssey (1968). He appears to be confused. When asked by a guard if he is all right, and if he is tired, he replies that he is tired.

The guard, Scott (Brian J. Smith) sees a boy and calls out the name "Matthew" and "give chase."

Dr. Rush (Robert Carlyle) enters a room and has a heated discussion with Col. Young (Louis Ferreira) and Camile (Ming-Na Wen). (I could not hear the English soundtrack, only the Russian.)

An alert sounded and there was fight in a large common area. Several members of the Destiny crew were present, and one man appeared to be fighting an imaginary enemy and had bloody lacerations on his forearm. The boy, Matthew, reappeared, and Scott gave chase.

Both Rush and Eli (David Blue) in separate scenes appeared unable to explain the events.

Scott caught up to Matthew. Matthew asked "Why did you leave me?"

Scott is called to sick bay. Lt. James is shocked to see him - he is the man she thought she had killed in her quarters.

Tamara Johansen (Alaina Huffman) finds something the size of a mole on the back of Scott's head. Dr. Volker is in restraints and required an injection to sedate him.

Scott sees Matthew in sick bay. Tamara starts to remove the "mole" from his head and he becomes unconscious and requires CPR. The mole appeared to have burrowed deeper into Scott's head. (I could not understand what Tamara said.)

Jumping ahead in the episode, Eli and Volker speak of the part of the brain that controls fear and anger, and others present all have had fearful or angry hallucinations.

Sgt. Greer (Jamil Walker Smith) appears to believe that civilians are trying to take over the ship, and wounds and takes Camile hostage. Rush leads a rescue party, and then attacks them as they subdue Greer and rescue Camile. Rush in turn is subdued.

(I was unable to hear an explanation as to what the "moles" were or how they were finally removed.)

The episode ends with a long musical interlude and different cast members looking serious. Destiny drops into sub-light speed, the stargate opens, the planet on the other end has a suitable atmosphere, and Young requests "18" (I assume this to be 18 people for a landing party).

synopsis_with_character_names: A nightmare haunts Dr Rush: he sees himself selling the Project Icarus to strangers. Young questions if the nightmares might be flashbacks from using the communication stones with Col Telford, and remembers the same thing happened with Lt Scott (Ep. 9: "Life). Rush offers himself to assume Col Telford's identity on Earth to try and contact his handlers, while Telford is detained against his will aboard 'Destiny'; but Young doubts Rush may be the mole and using Telford as a patsy, and warns Gen O'Neill about the plan. Young and O'Neill question Telford aboard 'Destiny' and prove he's the mole. Rush contacts Telford's handlers but ends prisioner to the Lucian Alliance, declared enemies of the Earth, and finds they've been after 'Destiny' for years - and have a way to get there: another 'Icarus' planet with stargate. His life at risk, Rush blows his cover and tries to connect the Lucians with 'Destiny' knowing he'll die if he doesn't - or kill his friends if he does.
